extension.valueString: A Bowie-Dick test cycle is a special cycle used to test the integrity of the sterilizer chamber to hold a vacuum.
A dart cycle is a special cycle used to test the integrity of the sterilizer chamber to hold a vacuum.
A dart warm-up cycle is used to bring the sterilizer chamber up to operating temperature in order to run a dart test cycle.
An express cycle is similar to a flash cycle but the supply item is wrapped.
Used to quickly sterilize instruments that were dropped during surgery.
A gravity cycle is executed at atmospheric pressure.
A leak test cycle tests the integrity of the sterilizer chamber to hold a vacuum over a specific period of time.
A cycle specific to sterilizing liquids.
A prevac cycle is vacuum assisted.
An SFPP cycle uses steam pulses instead of a vacuum during the conditioning phase of the cycle when the supply item is wrapped.
A Wrap/SFPP cycle uses steam pulses instead of a vacuum during the conditioning phase of the cycle when the supply item is unwrapped.

description: FHIR Value set/code system definition for HL7 v2 table 0702 ( Cycle Type)
name: v2 Cycle Type

text.div:
Cycle Type

CodeDescriptionCommentVersion
2RS Second Rinseadded v2.6

WFP Wrap/Steam Flush Pressure Pulse (Wrap/SFPP)A Wrap/SFPP cycle uses steam pulses instead of a vacuum during the conditioning phase of the cycle when the supply item is unwrapped.added v2.6
